aspect.name: Genomics
aspect.subtitle: Genome annotation
aspect.intro-text: The gene structures and other genome annotations in RatMine are provided by a variety of curated source databases including RGD, NCBI and Ensembl.

aspect.name: Quantitative Trait Loci
aspect.intro-text: A Quantitative Trait Locus (QTL) is a genomic region which has been statistically determined by intensive genetic crossing in rats or population studies in human to contain one or more elements linked to a measurable phenotypic trait. QTL data in RatMine has been manually curated by the Rat Genome Database.

aspect.name: Single Nucleotide Polymorphism
aspect.intro-text: A single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP, pronounced snip) is a DNA sequence variation occurring when a single nucleotide (A, T, C, or G) in the genome (or other shared sequence) differs between members of a species (or between paired chromosomes in an individual).

aspect.name: Proteins
aspect.subtitle:
Protein and proteomics
data
aspect.intro-text: RatMine includes protein data such as sequences, family associations, domain structures and gene associations downloaded from the UniProt Knowledgebase.

aspect.name: Gene Ontology
aspect.intro-text: The Gene Ontology (GO) is a combination of three controlled, hierarchical vocabularies designed to describe the molecular functions, biological processes and cellular components of gene products in a species-independent manner. GO annotations for rat genes in RatMine have been supplied by the Rat Genome Database.

aspect.name: Disease
aspect.subtitle: Disease Ontology
aspect.intro-text: The Rat Genome Database Disease Ontology (DO) is a controlled, hierarchical vocabulary based on the National Library of Medicine's Medical Subject Headings (MeSH). RGD manually assigns DO terms to rat genes, QTLs and strains, human genes and QTLs and mouse genes based on data from primary research articles. DO annotations for Rattus norvegicus, supplied by RGD, have been loaded into RatMine and linked to the corresponding genes such that the information available for each gene includes a list of its DO annotations.

aspect.name: Pathway
aspect.intro-text: The Pathway Ontology (PW) is a controlled, hierarchical vocabulary designed to describe a variety of biological networks and the relationships between them, including classic metabolic pathways, regulatory pathways, signaling pathways and disease pathways. PW assignments in RatMine have been manually curated by the Rat Genome Database.

aspect.name: Mammalian Phenotype
aspect.intro-text: The Mammalian Phenotype (MP) Ontology is a controlled, hierarchical vocabulary developed by Mouse Genome Informatics (MGI) to describe alterations in rat, mouse and human physiology and phenotypes. Phenotype data for rat genes, QTL and strains in RatMine has been manually curated by the Rat Genome Database.
